block.p: Edith Louise Josephson, a daughter of Ruth Goddard Josephson and Ronald P. Josephson of Simsbury, Conn., was married yesterday to David Robert Owen, a son of Lynn Rasmussen Owen and Judge Richard Owen of Manhattan. The Very Rev. James Parks Morton performed the ceremony at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine in Manhattan.
The couple are Dartmouth graduates and associates at Manhattan law firms, the bride at Dewey Ballantine and the bridegroom at Cahill, Gordon & Reindel.

Edith Louise Josephson, a daughter of Ruth Goddard Josephson and Ronald P. Josephson of Simsbury, Conn., was married yesterday to David Robert Owen, a son of Lynn Rasmussen Owen and Judge Richard Owen of Manhattan. The Very Rev. James Parks Morton performed the ceremony at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine in Manhattan.
The couple are Dartmouth graduates and associates at Manhattan law firms, the bride at Dewey Ballantine and the bridegroom at Cahill, Gordon & Reindel.

Mrs. Owen, 30, received her law degree from New York University. Her father is a gastroenterologist in Hartford and Avon, Conn., with Prime Health Care. Her mother is a teaching assistant in the toddlers program at the Cobb School, a Montessori school in Simsbury.

Mr. Owen, 31, received his law degree from Fordham University. In the late 1970's and early 80's, he was a boy soprano with the Metropolitan Opera and other opera companies. His mother, a soprano, performs in operas and recitals, and is a voice teacher at the Manhattan School of Music and Columbia University. His father sits on the Federal District Court in Manhattan and is a composer of operas.
